crypto

Class ElGamalCrypto

  • java.lang.Object
    • crypto.ElGamalCrypto

  • public class ElGamalCrypto
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements an El Gamal encryption key-pair, which can then be used (factory style) to encrypt or decrypt messages.

    • Method Detail

      • initMap

        private void initMap()

      • generate

        public Pair<Key> generate(java.lang.String id)
        Generate a new ElGamal key pair.
        Parameters:
        id - Identify the generated key pair with this string. (Generated key instances will have their id fields set to this value).
        Returns:
        This method returns a new key pair where the keys are arranged (public,private)

      • encrypt

        public Pair<java.math.BigInteger> encrypt(Key key,
                                 java.math.BigInteger plainText)
        Perform an encryption.
        Parameters:
        key - Encrypt with this key (should be generated by generate())
        plainText - Encrypt this plaintext.
        Returns:
        This method returns an ElGamal cipher Pair.

      • decrypt

        public java.math.BigInteger decrypt(Key key,
                           Pair<java.math.BigInteger> cipherText)
        Perform a normal decryption.
        Parameters:
        key - Decrypt with this key. (should be generated by generate())
        cipherText - Decrypt this cipher (should be generated by encrypt())
        Returns:
        This method returns the

      • decrypt

        public java.math.BigInteger decrypt(java.math.BigInteger r,
                           Key publickey,
                           Pair<java.math.BigInteger> cipherText)
        Perform a decryption without the decryption key, but with the randomness from the encryption
        Parameters:
        r - - random value used for encrypt
        cipherText - - cipherText
        publickey - - public counterpart of the private key used for encrypt
        Returns:
        the plain text

      • lookup

        private java.math.BigInteger lookup(java.math.BigInteger i)

      • getRecentRandomness

        public java.util.List<java.math.BigInteger> getRecentRandomness()
        Returns:
        This method returns the most recent randomness used by the encrypt method.

      • clearRecentRandomness

        public void clearRecentRandomness()
        Forget about the most recent randomness used by the encrypt method.

      • mult

        public Pair<java.math.BigInteger> mult(Pair<java.math.BigInteger> a,
                              Pair<java.math.BigInteger> b)
        homomorphic multiplication of ciphertext tuples - does not modify arguments. mult(encrypt(a), encrypt(b)) = encrypt(a * b)
